job.title: Content writer, DeFi
job.description:
About Crypto.com

Founded in 2016, Crypto.com today serves over 10 million customers with the world’s fastest growing crypto app, along with the Crypto.com Visa Card — the world’s largest crypto card program — the Crypto.com Exchange and Crypto.com DeFi Wallet. Recently launched, Crypto.com NFT is the premier platform for collecting and trading NFTs, carefully curated from the worlds of art, design, entertainment and sports.

Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have ISO/IEC 27701:2019, CCSS Level 3, ISO27001:2013 and PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level 1 compliance, and independently assessed at Tier 4, the highest level for both NIST Cybersecurity and Privacy Frameworks.

With over 2,600 people in offices across the Americas, Europe and Asia, Crypto.com is accelerating the world’s transition to cryptocurrency. Find out more: https://crypto.com


Role summary

As a Content Writer, DeFi and Gaming, you will be a key member of the DeFi team and will be responsible for creating high-quality written content that educates our community on the world of crypto, DeFi and Blockchain gaming, keeping them ahead of the crowd. Our team is fully remote, and we welcome candidates from anywhere in the APAC, EUR or UK timezones.

Responsibilities:

  • Write long-form articles on a variety of crypto-relevant topics that keep our community well-informed and knowledgeable on anything crypto: how-to trade, invest, and use crypto; press releases and recaps of industry events; use guides to DeFi protocols and blockchain gaming apps; crypto trends
  • Write matching social media posts to the long-form content
  • Work with a team copywriters, editors, and designers to create impactful and on-trend content for the crypto community
  • Conduct keyword/topics research to spot trending topics in the crypto space, especially for NFTs, Defi, GameFi, blockchain technology, and other emerging trends
  • Perform competitors content analysis to make sure we do not miss any opportunities
  • Keep abreast with the latest crypto and industry trends, consistently contributing fresh ideas to content creation
  • At least 3 years working experience in content writing and editing
  • Intricate knowledge on DeFi, blockchain, and cryptocurrencies
  • Native-level written communication skills in English
  • Knowledgeable on SEO and popular CMS (wordpress)
  • Preferably knowledgeable on Google Analytics, SEMrush, or other SEO tools
  • Pay minute attention to detail and work well in fast-paced environments
  • Experience working with well-known English media outlets or in corporate communications
  • Self-motivated, independent, strong team player
  • A university degree in Journalism, Communications, or related disciplines is a plus
  • Attractive compensation package
  • Working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech.
  • Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. The possibilities are limitless and depend on you
  • You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team
  • You will get to have involvement in developing content from scratch, alongside a talented team

job.title: Head of M&A Integration
job.description:
About Kraken

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. In our first decade, Kraken has risen to become one of the largest, most successful and respected crypto exchanges on the planet. 

We are changing the way the world thinks about finance and our range of successful products are playing a critical role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We continue to trail-blaze into new territory with the introduction of Kraken Bank, providing a more seamless integration between crypto and the traditional financial system. This makes us the first crypto company (ever) to be awarded a U.S. state banking charter. 

Our diverse group of 2,000+ Krakenites are distributed all over the world as part of our 'remote first' culture, united by a shared passion for delighting customers, upholding crypto values and achieving our meaningful mission. We attract people who push themselves to improve, are radically transparent and think differently in order to unlock their potential. 

Crypto is a rapidly evolving industry and we’re just getting started. We’re growing fast and you're invited to join the revolution!

This position will be responsible for working with a broad range of Business Leaders, Functional Leaders, and Corporate Development (1) to craft the integration approach for individual acquisitions of various sizes and complexity, and (2) to build the integration playbook for repeatable and effective cross-functional execution.  We are looking for an experienced and proactive leader with meaningful insights on best practices.  This team member will report to the VP of Business Operations and Expansion, which also holds responsibility for Corporate Development, Business Development, and Business Operations.
To be successful, you will have to be able to juggle multiple deal-related responsibilities in parallel, anticipate challenges and corresponding corrective actions, and be very flexible and organized.  We would expect you to be articulate, sensible, able to coordinate with other peers and senior executives, and collaborate and deliver results in a fast-paced environment where teamwork, professionalism, confidentiality, and communication are essential.  You will be a very key leader, with a mandate to define, grow, and manage an influential team of M&A Integration professionals. 

Responsibilities
  • Integration Model: Work closely with Corporate Development and other Functional Leaders to implement a repeatable and flexible cross-functional playbook for the integration of acquisitions of various sizes and complexity. 
  • Preparation: Set the broad integration strategy and tools, and define value drivers for each dealIntegration
  • Metrics:  Establish the key milestones, critical deliverables, and repeatable measured outcomes that drive the integration to delivering the value anticipated from the deal
  • Business Perspective: Contribute insights to business case development, value driver definition, and execution plans
  • Leadership: Encourage adoption of best practices suitable for each situation, and hold colleagues accountable for their contributions throughout the process
  • Coaching: Share experiences and know-how at each stage of the deal formulation, prosecution, diligence, and post-merger integration process to improve outcomes at all stages
  • Problem Solving: Identify and anticipate roadblocks, figure out constructive solutions, and prioritize the right countermeasures
  • Tracking: Track and report deal-by-deal performance during the immediate periods after closing as well as the overall performance of the acquisition portfolio to Functional Leaders, Executives, and the Board on various dimensions of Strategic and Financial Value attained through M&A activities
  • Communications: Convey in writing and in conversation concisely and clearly, so as to make complex problems and difficult decisions readily actionable by Executives

    • Requirements
  • MBA preferred
  • 12+ years with business operations experience likely spanning Strategy, Product, Operations, Finance, or Integration, with a minimum of 5 years of concentrated experience in integrations
  • Preference for direct experience with leading integration tools and methodologies from a publicly traded company, backed up with multiple years of experience at a top tier consulting firm
  • Familiarity with all stages of the M&A process and key requirements for delivery at each stage gained through experience across multiple domestic and international transactions of various sizes and complexity
  • Proven ability to lead team members who are direct reports as well as the peer team mates on projects
  • Thrives in a fast-paced environment where you get to utilize your resourceful, problem solving nature, and be able to maintain a professional demeanor while working under pressure
  • Strong analytical, strategic, and innovation skills
  • Ability to deal with conflicting priorities with ease and confidently communicate with team members at all levels
  • Highly tech savvy with strong emphasis on cyber security and privacy 
  • Self-starter yet seek and enjoy the opportunity to collaborate with others
  • Detail oriented and analytical, with the ability to follow-throughSelf-motivated and able to thrive in a result-driven environment with tight deadlines
  • Compassionate and caring to make the company culture and experience better for all team members
    • Location Tagging: #US #EU #LI-AN1 #LI-Remote #APAC #CANADA

    We’re powered by people from around the world with their own unique and diverse experiences. We value all Krakenites and their talents, contributions, and perspectives, regardless of their background.

Whether that’s based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws.

job.description:
Director, People Success

Flipside Crypto is making it’s first full-time hire in People Success (HR) to support the growth of our fantastic team. We are a rapidly scaling tech startup servicing the blockchain/crypto market…this means we assess, decide and adapt our business radically quickly. We are looking for someone to create and lead our new People Success team; to take our rich culture and rituals and constantly evolve them to meet the needs our people; to assess our existing approaches and help us scale them; and to be at the forefront of building a values rich, high integrity, diverse technology company in crypto.

Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, you will be a strategic business partner to our department leaders across Flipside Crypto. You will hire a People Success team that ensures our remote culture is rich, values-driven, and delivers high performance. This new leader should have 10+ years of experience as part of a People Success (HR) organization, with at least 5 years of experience leading people and setting direction for a team. You will lead all aspects of People Success including business partnership, talent acquisition, people operations, employee relations, professional development and benefits management.

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with the leadership team to implement strategies that develop our workforce while improving the overall employee experience.
  • Design a high-impact People Success organization and hire new employees to execute on this strategy
  • Provide business partnership and guidance to department leaders across Flipside.
  • Lead the development of talent management processes that continue our history of high performing, empowered teams
  • Provide strategic partnership and mentorship to employees and people managers at all levels to positively impact the motivation, development, and retention of talent.
  • Lead and provide guidance on employee relations matters
  • Lead our high quality, high velocity talent acquisition efforts ensuring we move quickly, provide our hiring teams the tools and training they need, and create a fantastic candidate experience for any potential team member - whether or not they are offered a position at Flipside.

Requirements

  • 10+ years in a people function
  • 5+ years in a leadership role
  • Proven ability to partner with executive leadership
  • Demonstrated success in a high-growth organization
  • Strong teamwork, communication & cross-functional collaboration skills
  • Entrepreneurial spirit/mindset, flexibility toward dynamic change
  • Ability to perform in a fast-paced environment, with multiple stakeholders with varying needs
  • Strong experience in wide variety of people success strategy and operations
  • Experience working in the Technology industry
  • Experience in a crypto organization is not required, but a big advantage in understanding the unique culture and ethos of this market.

We welcome all qualified persons to apply regardless of race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Compensation will be competitive and commensurate with experience.

About Flipside

Flipside Crypto empowers crypto communities to create and share data-driven insights on the projects they care most about. Flipside powers Community-Enabled Analytics, which uses a bounty program to incentivize on-demand insights based on feedback from the protocol and community participants. CEA provides fully pre-modeled and labeled data, a SQL interface for data queries. Community members can use our dashboard and visualization tools to easily share insights, or leverage auto-generated API endpoints to build whatever they can imagine.

Flipside customers include FLOW, NEAR, Terra, Algorand, Aave, Compound, Alchemix and many others. Flipside Crypto is led by a team of experienced technology entrepreneurs with multiple exits; it’s backed by Galaxy Digital Ventures, True Ventures, Founder Collective, Coinbase Ventures, Digital Currency Group, Avon Ventures (a venture capital fund affiliated with FMR LLC, the parent company of Fidelity Investments) and other investors.
